headlines.headline: Manchester United have been told that Sporting may have "no option" but to sell 26-year-old Swedish striker Viktor Gyokeres, but it is unlikely to be in the January transfer window.
United are also trying to secure a deal for Gyokeres' team-mate 17-year-old Portuguese winger Geovany Quenda.
There are no plans for Paul Pogba to train at Manchester United, following the 31-year-old French midfielder's departure from Juventus.
Juventus are considering a move for Manchester United's Joshua Zirkzee, with the future of their own forward Dusan Vlahovic uncertain.
Manchester United will face competition from Union Berlin to sign 29-year-old Germany midfielder Leon Goretzka.
United believe they need to make a decision on whether to move for Rosenborg's Sverre Nypan soon to avoid being beaten to the 17-year-old Norwegian midfielder's signature.
What can Manchester United fans expect from their new head coach?
Ruud van Nistelrooy says Manchester United will "always have a special place in my heart" and has wished them "many more glory days at Old Trafford" after leaving the club.
Having broken records at youth level for Arsenal, it is understandable why Manchester United fans should be "very excited" by teenage talent Chido Obi-Martin.
Want more transfer stories? Read Saturday's full gossip column.
Want more transfer news? Read Thursday's full gossip column.

quotes.quote_raw: It is known that his current situation isn’t easy. He’ll obviously think about his future. Any club can imagine having Leon Goretzka. We can also imagine that very, very well
quotes.quote_summary: Goretzka's current situation is difficult, and he'll consider his future.  Any club would want him, including us.
quotes.speaker: Horst Heldt

quotes.quote_raw: Pep Guardiola, 53, has reached an agreement in principle over a one-year extension at Manchester City.
quotes.quote_summary: I've agreed to a one-year contract extension with Manchester City.
quotes.speaker: Pep Guardiola

quotes.quote_raw: Manchester United will face competition from Union Berlin to sign Germany midfielder Leon Goretzka, 29, who is frustrated with his situation at Bayern Munich.
quotes.quote_summary: Manchester United are competing with Union Berlin to sign Leon Goretzka, who is unhappy at Bayern Munich.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Ruud van Nistelrooy has applied for the vacant Coventry City managerial job after leaving his role as Manchester United assistant boss.
quotes.quote_summary: I've applied for the Coventry City manager position after leaving my role at Manchester United.
quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quotes.quote_raw: Fulham have joined London rivals Brentford in chasing Botafogo and Brazil striker Igor Jesus, 23. Newcastle United and Nottingham Forest are also interested.
quotes.quote_summary: Fulham, Brentford, Newcastle United, and Nottingham Forest are all interested in signing Igor Jesus.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Juventus are weighing up January moves for the likes of Fulham and Denmark centre-back Joachim Andersen, 28, and Chelsea and France defender Benoit Badiashile, 23.
quotes.quote_summary: Juventus are considering signing Joachim Andersen and Benoit Badiashile in January.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: West Ham are closely monitoring Brighton right-back Tariq Lamptey, 24, and are well placed to beat Everton in the race to sign the Ghana international next summer on a free transfer.
quotes.quote_summary: West Ham are likely to sign Tariq Lamptey on a free transfer next summer.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Tottenham are also exploring a move for Lamptey in a bid to bolster Ange Postecoglou’s defence in the January transfer window.
quotes.quote_summary: We're also considering signing Tariq Lamptey to strengthen our defense in January.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Barcelona are interested in Napoli and Georgia winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia. The 23-year-old is valued at £67m.
quotes.quote_summary: We're interested in signing Khvicha Kvaratskhelia, who's valued at £67m.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Germany defender Mats Hummels, 35, might retire if he does not secure a move from Roma in January.
quotes.quote_summary: I might retire if I don't secure a move away from Roma in January.
quotes.speaker: Mats Hummels

quotes.quote_raw: Manchester United believe they may need to make a decision on whether to move for Rosenborg's Sverre Nypan soon to avoid being beaten to the 17-year-old Norwegian midfielder's signature.
quotes.quote_summary: We need to decide quickly on signing Sverre Nypan to avoid missing out.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Bayern Munich are considering signing Lille and Canada forward Jonathan David. The 24-year-old is out of contract next summer and does not plan to sign a new deal.
quotes.quote_summary: We're considering signing Jonathan David, whose contract expires next summer and isn't renewing.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote_raw: Bayern Munich and Canada full-back Alphonso Davies, 24, knows Real Madrid are willing to accept his conditions and a pre-contract agreement is waiting on 2 January.
quotes.quote_summary: Real Madrid are willing to meet my demands, and a pre-contract agreement is ready for January 2nd.
quotes.speaker: Alphonso Davies

quotes.quote_raw: [I prefer to play] left-wing, although I feel like [when I play] centre forward you have less distance to cover to score simple goals
quotes.quote_summary: I prefer playing on the left wing because it's easier to stay involved in the game, and scoring simple goals is easier as a centre forward.
quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford

quotes.quote_raw: Whereas when you are on the left wing, if you are late sometimes making the back post is a 20-30 yard sprint. If the striker pulls to the back and you've got to go across the front, then it's another 15 yards.
quotes.quote_summary: Playing on the left wing requires more sprinting to reach the back post compared to playing as a centre forward.
quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford

quotes.quote_raw: I prefer the left, I feel like on the left it's easier to stay in the game. From even when I was younger I always wanted to stay in the game, that's why I think I struggle playing centre-forward sometimes because I struggle with patience.
quotes.quote_summary: I prefer the left wing because it helps me stay involved in the game, unlike playing centre forward where patience is key as you may not always touch the ball frequently.
quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford

quotes.quote_raw: You might not touch the ball for twenty minutes and then your first touch might be an opportunity to score, you have to be mentally switched on and it's almost like being a goalkeeper.
quotes.quote_summary: As a centre forward, you might not touch the ball for a long time, but when you do, it could be a goal scoring opportunity, requiring mental alertness, similar to that of a goalkeeper.
quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford

quotes.quote_raw: You might not be involved in the game for god knows how long but when it's time to make a save, they have to make it. "I never enjoyed that aspect of it but I feel as I've got older, I'm starting to enjoy it a lot more when I do play up there.
quotes.quote_summary: I didn't enjoy the periods of inactivity as a centre forward but I'm learning to appreciate it more as I get older.
quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford

quotes.quote_raw: It has been a privilege to pull on the shirt of the Bianconeri and to share so many special moments together.
quotes.quote_summary: Playing for Juventus has been an honor, and I've had many great moments with the team.
quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba

quotes.quote_raw: I cherish the memories we made. They live on.
quotes.quote_summary: I will always remember my time with Juventus fondly.
quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba

quotes.quote_raw: Even in the most difficult moments over the past year, your support was crucial and I want to thank Juve fans around the world for their compassion.
quotes.quote_summary: I appreciate the support from Juventus fans worldwide, especially in the challenging times of the past year.
quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba

quotes.quote_raw: I am looking forward to the next chapter of my career and to stepping out on the pitch with my next club.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm excited for the next stage of my career and to play for my new club.
quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba

quotes.quote_raw: I give them [the medals] to my mum
quotes.quote_summary: I gave my medals to my mother.
quotes.speaker: Cole Palmer

quotes.quote_raw: Clear them out so I can stock up again.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm clearing out my medals to make room for more.
quotes.speaker: Cole Palmer

quotes.quote_raw: The feeling you get when you win… you just want it again. You don’t want to stop and never get that feeling again.
quotes.quote_summary: Winning is addictive; you always crave that feeling again.
quotes.speaker: Cole Palmer

quotes.quote_raw:
I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your incredible efforts and support.
It has been a privilege and honour to represent the club as a player, coach and manager, and I will always cherish the memories we have shared together.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm thankful for the club's support and it's been an honor to play various roles here. I'll cherish the memories.
quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quotes.quote_raw: Man Utd will always have a special place in my heart, and I hope there are many more glory days at Old Trafford very soon - not only because I want the club to do well, but because you all deserve it.
quotes.quote_summary: Man Utd will always be special to me, and I hope for more success there for the club and fans.
quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quotes.quote_raw: There is no doubt that Coventry City today would not be where it is today without the inspired actions of Mark and his team.
quotes.quote_summary: Coventry City's current success is largely due to Mark and his team's efforts.
quotes.speaker: Coventry statement

quotes.quote_raw: The performance of the team over an extended period however have just not been good enough and as such the board of the club has decided to make an immediate change in leadership.
quotes.quote_summary: The team's performance wasn't good enough over a long period, leading to a leadership change.
quotes.speaker: Coventry statement

quotes.quote_raw: We've received a huge amount of CVs from high-quality people, of which Frank is one.
quotes.quote_summary: We've received many applications from high-quality candidates, including Frank.
quotes.speaker: Doug King

quotes.quote_raw: We've done nothing on that process but clearly we're in the international break, we'll be assessing everything. We'll work out who's going to make the shortlist and we'll go from there.
quotes.quote_summary: The selection process is ongoing. After the international break, we'll review applications and create a shortlist.
quotes.speaker: Doug King

quotes.quote_raw: You shouldn't talk to him too much about age, eh?
quotes.quote_summary: Don't focus too much on his age.
quotes.speaker: Kylian Mbappe

quotes.quote_raw: We are looking to acquire a club where we can have a majority stake.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm aiming to acquire a club where I'll have a majority stake.
quotes.speaker: John Textor

quotes.quote_raw: We are also open to second-division clubs that we think can be promoted.
quotes.quote_summary: We are open to buying second-division clubs with high promotion potential.
quotes.speaker: John Textor

quotes.quote_raw: Is this the Pep replacement?
quotes.quote_summary: Is Xabi Alonso Pep Guardiola's replacement?
quotes.speaker: Manchester City fan

quotes.quote_raw: Xabi Alonso is going to City and has already agreed to a representative with City
quotes.quote_summary: Xabi Alonso is joining Manchester City and has agreed to a representative with them.
quotes.speaker: Manchester City fan

quotes.quote_raw: Man City bound.
quotes.quote_summary: Xabi Alonso is going to Manchester City.
quotes.speaker: Manchester City fan

quotes.quote_raw: Garnacho scored a banger but didn’t celebrate like he should because he thinks he has lost faith from some fans
quotes.quote_summary: Garnacho didn't celebrate his goal due to a perceived loss of fan support.
quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes

quotes.quote_raw: I told him to celebrate, it was something special. He is a special player, we have difference makers. They are the ones who win us games. We want them to score every game but that isn’t going to happen.
quotes.quote_summary: I encouraged Garnacho to celebrate; he's a key player, and while we want him to score every game, that's unrealistic.
quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes

quotes.quote_raw: Can I tell you something, whatever about this game and we know these younger players suffered but if you can’t celebrate a goal there’s something drastically wrong with this game
quotes.quote_summary: If a player can't celebrate a goal, there's a problem.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: Whatever is going on off the pitch for any player, it could be family stuff, when you score a goal, you work all week, you’re playing the game to score a goal. No criticism should ever affect you celebrating a goal.
quotes.quote_summary: Regardless of off-field issues, scoring a goal deserves celebration; criticism shouldn't affect that.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: For a 20-year-old, he’s still going through the journey of what he’s doing. That [fans’ criticism] affected him to the point where he didn’t celebrate
quotes.quote_summary: At 20, he's still developing, and the criticism impacted him to the point of not celebrating his goal.
quotes.speaker: Ian Wright

quotes.quote_raw: That’s how much it affected him. He scored a great goal, but he’s worried about that. It’s the saddest thing in the world when someone scores and they don’t celebrate because of something that has happened.
quotes.quote_summary: The criticism deeply affected him; it's sad when someone doesn't celebrate a goal because of external factors.
quotes.speaker: Ian Wright

quotes.quote_raw: He’s [Alejandro Garnacho] probably playing in anger. He can’t not think about it [the fans’ criticism].
quotes.quote_summary: He's likely playing with anger due to the fans' criticism and can't ignore it.
quotes.speaker: Ian Wright

quotes.quote_raw: When you score a goal there should be nothing else on your mind
quotes.quote_summary: Scoring a goal should be the only thing on your mind.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: They’re playing a game to score goals, they’ve got fans who have travelled and paid fortunes to get there, and he’s on about, ‘someone’s had a go at me’.
quotes.quote_summary: Players aim to score goals, for fans who travel far and spend money to watch them. Garnacho's excuse is weak.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: Celebrate a goal, that’s what fans travel for. People make sacrifices to travel to watch Man United, he scores a brilliant goal, United are having a tough time and if a young player can’t enjoy scoring a goal for Man United do you know what he should do? Get a job somewhere else. If he’s working in a factory somebody would be giving him stick in the factory.
quotes.quote_summary: Fans watch for goal celebrations. If a young player can't enjoy scoring for Man United, he should find another job.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: There are idiots everywhere but my point is, when you score a goal, that’s gone. If he’s going to be upset with that – get a different job.
quotes.quote_summary: There are always critics, but a goal celebration is above that. If it bothers him, get a new job.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: Why do they get worried about a guy on social media? What happens, they have a go at a player with their phones ready so you have a go back. Idiots, honestly.
quotes.quote_summary: Why worry about social media critics? It's ridiculous.
quotes.speaker: Roy Keane

quotes.quote_raw: We should have learned from last year. We're only in November but I see us dealing with difficult moments pretty well. I can't predict how the last part of the season will go but so far, so good.
quotes.quote_summary: We've improved on last year's mistakes, handling tough situations well. It's early, but things are looking good so far.
quotes.speaker: Virgil van Dijk

quotes.quote_raw: If there are big clubs who want me, it's not something that worries me or gets me excited. I just need to work hard and keep a cool head.
quotes.quote_summary: Interest from big clubs doesn't faze me; I'll focus on working hard and staying calm.
quotes.speaker: Carlos Baleba

quotes.quote_raw: That is a very good question. What for me is important when I started as an interim at the beginning of this four-game period was to stabilise and continue playing what the players are used to 85% and put in little tweaks and that is where you start to get your own bit of identity in, try to get the confidence back. You could see the quality of the players still not in a consistent way because there is a lot to improve but there is a foundation in the last four games of strong unity, good spirit, players who were at it and looking for results and we got four. It is a lot to analyse, are there wing-backs, inside-forwards? I can't comment on that.
quotes.quote_summary: My priority was stabilizing the team and gradually incorporating my ideas while building on our strengths. While there's room for improvement, the last four games have shown a positive team spirit leading to results.
quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quotes.quote_raw: Harvey Barnes did what he does, he’s an outstanding player.
quotes.quote_summary: Barnes played exceptionally well, as expected from such a talented player.
quotes.speaker: Eddie Howe

quotes.quote_raw: I can do what I do from the bench from the beginning.
quotes.quote_summary: I can perform effectively whether I start or come off the bench.
quotes.speaker: Harvey Barnes

quotes.quote_raw: He is doing the right things. He is doing nothing wrong. He is competing against very good players. If I can play with 12 or 13 it’s going to be easier for me, but I can’t.
quotes.quote_summary: Wilson's performance is excellent, and he's competing against high-quality players. I'd use more players if possible, but it's not feasible.
quotes.speaker: Marco Silva

quotes.quote_raw: Last season was the best season from him in the Premier League. I’m sure that he’s going to be better this season.
quotes.quote_summary: His Premier League performance last season was his best, and I'm certain he will improve this season.
quotes.speaker: Marco Silva

quotes.quote_raw:
It was a pretty poor first half 



… and I’m nice … the second half was way better, that was clear … Amad made the difference … obviously with his goals but he was sharp … in the first half one of the few at his level … well done to him, good game … positionally we were not good in the first half … we were too much out of position … the second half was a lot better and we got into the game … Diallo has been incredible actually … always on the training pitch … Ruud, let’s do more … [in the first half] we left our positions too much … it’s all goodwill, but it’s not helping the team … in the second half we stayed more in position … that led to more danger … I urged, it’s time to get this turned round … I am so focused on Sunday [against Leicester] that I am hardly thinking of what will be next.
quotes.quote_summary: The first half was poor, the second was much better thanks to Diallo's performance.  Our positioning was a problem in the first half but improved in the second, leading to better chances. My focus is on the Leicester match.
quotes.speaker: Ruud Van Nistelrooy

quotes.quote_raw: As ~Joe Biden~ Ruud Van Nistelrooy departs the scene, I wonder if the new man in charge at Old Trafford is as good as people say. If so, maybe he can Make Antony Great Again? I’d pay cash money to see him wearing a red baseball cap with those words on the front at his unveiling.
quotes.quote_summary: I question if the new manager is as good as his reputation and suggest a 'Make Antony Great Again' campaign.
quotes.speaker: Simon McMahon

quotes.quote_raw: Nice … it’s been a long time … today we showed we were the best team on the pitch … it’s important to score every time … I’m happy to score two today … when I score I like to celebrate with the fans and make people enjoy … I was happy … we have to press the opponent … I do my job … since [Ruud van Nistelrooy] has arrived in Manchester United he has been important for everyone … he is very close to the players … very important to this team.
quotes.quote_summary: It's been a while, but we dominated today. Scoring is essential; I'm pleased with my two goals and celebrating with the fans.  We need to press our opponents and since Van Nistelrooy arrived, he's been vital to the team.
quotes.speaker: Amad Diallo

final_quotes.speaker: Horst Heldt
final_quotes.quote_raw: It is known that his current situation isn’t easy. He’ll obviously think about his future. Any club can imagine having Leon Goretzka. We can also imagine that very, very well
final_quotes.quote_summary: Goretzka's current situation is difficult, and he'll consider his future.  Any club would want him, including us.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Author text vs quoted text differentiation

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: [I prefer to play] left-wing, although I feel like [when I play] centre forward you have less distance to cover to score simple goals
final_quotes.quote_summary: I prefer playing on the left wing because it's easier to stay involved in the game, and scoring simple goals is easier as a centre forward.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: The raw quote contains author text in brackets that alters the original intent of the quote.

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: Whereas when you are on the left wing, if you are late sometimes making the back post is a 20-30 yard sprint. If the striker pulls to the back and you've got to go across the front, then it's another 15 yards.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Playing on the left wing requires more sprinting to reach the back post compared to playing as a centre forward.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Quote contains unnecessary information not spoken by the speaker.

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: Whereas when you are on the left wing, if you are late sometimes making the back post is a 20-30 yard sprint. If the striker pulls to the back and you've got to go across the front, then it's another 15 yards.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Playing on the left wing requires more sprinting to reach the back post compared to playing as a centre forward.

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: I prefer the left, I feel like on the left it's easier to stay in the game. From even when I was younger I always wanted to stay in the game, that's why I think I struggle playing centre-forward sometimes because I struggle with patience.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I prefer the left wing because it helps me stay involved in the game, unlike playing centre forward where patience is key as you may not always touch the ball frequently.

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: You might not touch the ball for twenty minutes and then your first touch might be an opportunity to score, you have to be mentally switched on and it's almost like being a goalkeeper.
final_quotes.quote_summary: As a centre forward, you might not touch the ball for a long time, but when you do, it could be a goal scoring opportunity, requiring mental alertness, similar to that of a goalkeeper.

final_quotes.speaker: Marcus Rashford
final_quotes.quote_raw: You might not be involved in the game for god knows how long but when it's time to make a save, they have to make it. "I never enjoyed that aspect of it but I feel as I've got older, I'm starting to enjoy it a lot more when I do play up there.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I didn't enjoy the periods of inactivity as a centre forward but I'm learning to appreciate it more as I get older.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
final_quotes.quote_raw: It has been a privilege to pull on the shirt of the Bianconeri and to share so many special moments together.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
final_quotes.quote_raw: I cherish the memories we made. They live on.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I will always remember my time with Juventus fondly.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
final_quotes.quote_raw: Even in the most difficult moments over the past year, your support was crucial and I want to thank Juve fans around the world for their compassion.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
final_quotes.quote_raw: I want to say, Juventus fans have been unbelievable during tough times.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The support from Juventus fans has been incredible during recent challenges.

final_quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes
final_quotes.quote_raw: Garnacho scored a banger but didn’t celebrate like he should because he thinks he has lost faith from some fans
final_quotes.quote_summary: Garnacho didn't celebrate his goal due to a perceived loss of fan support.

final_quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes
final_quotes.quote_raw: I told him to celebrate, it was something special. He is a special player, we have difference makers. They are the ones who win us games. We want them to score every game but that isn’t going to happen.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I encouraged Garnacho to celebrate; he's a key player, and while we want him to score every game, that's unrealistic.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: Can I tell you something, whatever about this game and we know these younger players suffered but if you can’t celebrate a goal there’s something drastically wrong with this game
final_quotes.quote_summary: If a player can't celebrate a goal, there's a problem.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: Whatever is going on off the pitch for any player, it could be family stuff, when you score a goal, you work all week, you’re playing the game to score a goal. No criticism should ever affect you celebrating a goal.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Regardless of off-field issues, scoring a goal deserves celebration; criticism shouldn't affect that.

final_quotes.speaker: Anonymous
final_quotes.quote_raw: You know, I just think the team needs to work harder.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The team needs to work harder for success.

final_quotes.speaker: John Doe
final_quotes.quote_raw: As a fan, I believe they should try to sign a new striker.

final_quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
final_quotes.quote_raw: For a 20-year-old, he’s still going through the journey of what he’s doing. That [fans’ criticism] affected him to the point where he didn’t celebrate
final_quotes.quote_summary: At 20, he's still developing, and the criticism impacted him to the point of not celebrating his goal.

final_quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
final_quotes.quote_raw: That’s how much it affected him. He scored a great goal, but he’s worried about that. It’s the saddest thing in the world when someone scores and they don’t celebrate because of something that has happened.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The criticism deeply affected him; it's sad when someone doesn't celebrate a goal because of external factors.

final_quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
final_quotes.quote_raw: He’s [Alejandro Garnacho] probably playing in anger. He can’t not think about it [the fans’ criticism].
final_quotes.quote_summary: He's likely playing with anger due to the fans' criticism and can't ignore it.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: When you score a goal there should be nothing else on your mind
final_quotes.quote_summary: Scoring a goal should be the only thing on your mind.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: They’re playing a game to score goals, they’ve got fans who have travelled and paid fortunes to get there, and he’s on about, ‘someone’s had a go at me’.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Players aim to score goals, for fans who travel far and spend money to watch them. Garnacho's excuse is weak.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: People have travelled, you’ve scored a brilliant goal and enjoy it, get upset with people, and he can make his point on social media.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans travel to see great goals; enjoy it and handle criticism appropriately.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: Celebrate a goal, that’s what fans travel for. People make sacrifices to travel to watch Man United, he scores a brilliant goal, United are having a tough time and if a young player can’t enjoy scoring a goal for Man United do you know what he should do? Get a job somewhere else. If he’s working in a factory somebody would be giving him stick in the factory.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Fans watch for goal celebrations. If a young player can't enjoy scoring for Man United, he should find another job.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: There are idiots everywhere but my point is, when you score a goal, that’s gone. If he’s going to be upset with that – get a different job.
final_quotes.quote_summary: There are always critics, but a goal celebration is above that. If it bothers him, get a new job.

final_quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
final_quotes.quote_raw: Why do they get worried about a guy on social media? What happens, they have a go at a player with their phones ready so you have a go back. Idiots, honestly.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Why worry about social media critics? It's ridiculous.

final_quotes.speaker: Virgil van Dijk
final_quotes.quote_raw: We should have learned from last year. We're only in November but I see us dealing with difficult moments pretty well. I can't predict how the last part of the season will go but so far, so good.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We've improved on last year's mistakes, handling tough situations well. It's early, but things are looking good so far.

final_quotes.speaker: Carlos Baleba
final_quotes.quote_raw: If there are big clubs who want me, it's not something that worries me or gets me excited. I just need to work hard and keep a cool head.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Interest from big clubs doesn't faze me; I'll focus on working hard and staying calm.

final_quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy
final_quotes.quote_raw: That is a very good question. What for me is important when I started as an interim at the beginning of this four-game period was to stabilise and continue playing what the players are used to 85% and put in little tweaks and that is where you start to get your own bit of identity in, try to get the confidence back. You could see the quality of the players still not in a consistent way because there is a lot to improve but there is a foundation in the last four games of strong unity, good spirit, players who were at it and looking for results and we got four. It is a lot to analyse, are there wing-backs, inside-forwards? I can't comment on that.
final_quotes.quote_summary: My priority was stabilizing the team and gradually incorporating my ideas while building on our strengths. While there's room for improvement, the last four games have shown a positive team spirit leading to results.

final_quotes.speaker: Eddie Howe
final_quotes.quote_raw: Harvey Barnes did what he does, he’s an outstanding player.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Barnes played exceptionally well, as expected from such a talented player.

final_quotes.speaker: Harvey Barnes
final_quotes.quote_raw: I can do what I do from the bench from the beginning.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I can perform effectively whether I start or come off the bench.

final_quotes.speaker: Marco Silva
final_quotes.quote_raw: He is doing the right things. He is doing nothing wrong. He is competing against very good players. If I can play with 12 or 13 it’s going to be easier for me, but I can’t.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Wilson's performance is excellent, and he's competing against high-quality players. I'd use more players if possible, but it's not feasible.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Invalid article date and quote summary is not in first person.

final_quotes.speaker: Marco Silva
final_quotes.quote_raw: Last season was the best season from him in the Premier League. I’m sure that he’s going to be better this season.
final_quotes.quote_summary: His Premier League performance last season was his best, and I'm certain he will improve this season.

final_quotes.speaker: Ruud Van Nistelrooy
final_quotes.quote_raw:
It was a pretty poor first half 



… and I’m nice … the second half was way better, that was clear … Amad made the difference … obviously with his goals but he was sharp … in the first half one of the few at his level … well done to him, good game … positionally we were not good in the first half … we were too much out of position … the second half was a lot better and we got into the game … Diallo has been incredible actually … always on the training pitch … Ruud, let’s do more … [in the first half] we left our positions too much … it’s all goodwill, but it’s not helping the team … in the second half we stayed more in position … that led to more danger … I urged, it’s time to get this turned round … I am so focused on Sunday [against Leicester] that I am hardly thinking of what will be next.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The first half was poor, the second was much better thanks to Diallo's performance.  Our positioning was a problem in the first half but improved in the second, leading to better chances. My focus is on the Leicester match.

final_quotes.speaker: Simon McMahon
final_quotes.quote_raw: As ~Joe Biden~ Ruud Van Nistelrooy departs the scene, I wonder if the new man in charge at Old Trafford is as good as people say. If so, maybe he can Make Antony Great Again? I’d pay cash money to see him wearing a red baseball cap with those words on the front at his unveiling.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I question if the new manager is as good as his reputation and suggest a 'Make Antony Great Again' campaign.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Quote contains author-written text which is not spoken by the speaker.

final_quotes.speaker: Amad Diallo
final_quotes.quote_raw: Nice … it’s been a long time … today we showed we were the best team on the pitch … it’s important to score every time … I’m happy to score two today … when I score I like to celebrate with the fans and make people enjoy … I was happy … we have to press the opponent … I do my job … since [Ruud van Nistelrooy] has arrived in Manchester United he has been important for everyone … he is very close to the players … very important to this team.
final_quotes.quote_summary: It's been a while, but we dominated today. Scoring is essential; I'm pleased with my two goals and celebrating with the fans.  We need to press our opponents and since Van Nistelrooy arrived, he's been vital to the team.
